author: Connie Ogle
title: The rules for drinking margaritas, even though tequila wants to kill you
text:
A 360-degree look at Miami Beach nightclub Copa Room 2. Does a margarita have to have salt on the rim? 
Yes! For God’s sake, that’s the whole point, the delicious interplay of the salt and the lime and the T word. Up your high blood pressure meds and dive in. Take me there 3. Can I drink a frozen margarita or am I really lame for asking? 
I’m giving you the side-eye right now. Really. Frozen margaritas are for pale northern tourists who panic at the sight of the Golden Glades Interchange or a flying cockroach. Real adults drink them on the rocks. Continued below 4. Can the margarita be served in a regular glass or must it come in one of those big only-for-margarita glasses? 
If it’s made with fresh lime juice, you can drink it out of a coffee mug or trash can and it would be acceptable. 5. What’s up with that giant margarita that has a bottle of Corona dumped upside down in it? Should I order one? 
No. Not even ironically.
